text: Karim Allawi Homaidi (), (born July 1, 1928) is a former international Iraqi football player, who was one of the first players to play in first Iraq national football team, he also played for Al-Minaa. ==International career== In April 1951, Allawi started playing for the first Iraq national football team, He was called by coach Dhia Habib to play in the first international friendly in the history of Iraqi football. On 6 May 1951, Allawi played his first international against Turkey B in Turkey, which ended 7–0 for Turkey B. Karim Allawi played in the inside left position and wore the No.10 jersey against the Turks. ==Honours== ===Club=== *Hanna Al-Sheikh Cup ** Winner 1951 with Al-Minaa ==References== ==External links== * Iraqi national team players database * Iraq - Record International Players - Hassanin Mubarak * History of Iraqi Sports, 1951 *Al-Minaa Club: Sailors of south Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:Iraqi footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Al-Mina'a SC players Category:Sportspeople from Basra Category:Iraq international footballers
title: Karim Allawi Homaidi
